title: Cloud Computing
description: Master cloud platforms, services, and deployment strategies

questions.question: What are the three main cloud service models?
questions.explanation: The three service models are: Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), and Software as a Service (SaaS), each offering different levels of abstraction.

questions.question: What is the main advantage of cloud computing's elasticity?
options: Automatic scaling of resources based on demand
questions.explanation: Elasticity allows cloud resources to automatically scale up or down based on demand, ensuring optimal performance while minimizing costs by paying only for what you use.

questions.question: What is the difference between horizontal and vertical scaling?
options: Horizontal adds more machines, vertical adds more power to existing machines
Vertical is always better than horizontal
Horizontal scaling is only for databases
questions.explanation: Horizontal scaling (scale out) adds more servers to handle load, while vertical scaling (scale up) increases the power (CPU, RAM) of existing servers.

questions.question: What is a Content Delivery Network (CDN)?
options: A network of distributed servers that deliver content closer to users
questions.explanation: A CDN is a geographically distributed network of servers that cache and deliver content from locations closer to users, reducing latency and improving performance.

questions.question: What is serverless computing?
options: A model where cloud providers manage infrastructure and you only pay for execution time
questions.explanation: Serverless computing lets developers run code without managing servers. The cloud provider handles infrastructure, and you pay only for actual execution time and resources used.

questions.question: What is Infrastructure as Code (IaC)?
options: Managing and provisioning infrastructure through code rather than manual processes
questions.explanation: IaC is the practice of managing and provisioning computing infrastructure through machine-readable files, enabling version control, automation, and consistent deployments.

questions.question: What is a microservices architecture?
options: An architectural approach where applications are built as independent, loosely coupled services
questions.explanation: Microservices architecture breaks down applications into small, independent services that communicate over well-defined APIs, enabling better scalability and maintainability.
